description: Number of i such that d(i)>d(i-1), where Sum{d(i)*4^i: i=0,1,....,m} is base 4 representation of n.
comments: From _Jeffrey Shallit_, May 15 2016: (Start)A "2-regular" sequence, satisfying the recurrence relations:a(4n+3) = a(n)a(16n) = a(16n+1) = a(16n+2) = a(4n)a(16n+5) = a(16n+6) = a(4n+1)a(16n+8) = a(16n+9) = a(4n+2) + 1a(16n+10) = a(4n+2)a(16n+12) = a(16n+13) = a(16n+14) = a(4n+1) + 1a(64n+4) = a(4n) + 1a(64n+20) = a(16n+4)a(64n+36) = a(4n+2) + 2a(64n+52) = a(n) + 2(End)
links: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: A037819 := proc(n)    a := 0 ;    dgs := convert(n,base,4);    for i from 2 to nops(dgs) do        if op(i,dgs)>op(i-1,dgs) then            a := a+1 ;        end if;    end do:    a ;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 15 2015
